results.title: Hannibal (D) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Universal Studios, Dino De Laurentiis, Martha De Laurentiis and Ridley Scott
results.brief_description: Based on the controversial sequel novel, “Hannibal” is the follow-up film to “Silence of the Lambs”. After ten years of hiding following his escape from custody, Hannibal Lecter, a feared and cunning serial killer, resurfaces to toy with FBI agent Clarice Starling. As Starling’s career flounders thanks to an ill-fated drug bust, Lecter attempts to elude an Italian police detective who has cottoned on to Lecter’s true identity. We are also introduced to a maimed and wealthy former victim of Lecter’s, Mason Verger, who plots to avenge the doctor in a most grisly and unusual manner. Cast includes: Anthony Hopkins, Julianne Moore, Ray Liotta, Frankie R. Faison, Giancarlo Giannini and Gary Oldman (uncredited and unrecognisable as Mason Verger).

results.title: Hannah and the dog ghost
results.brief_description: A folktale about Hannah, a young widow who lives with her son in Texas at the turn of the century. When her son is stolen by an evil fiddle man, Hannah rescues him after a series of adventures in which she is aided by a mysterious dog. Stars Vickie Washington.

results.title: Hannah and her sisters
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Robert Greenhut and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: An adult and incisively intelligent comedy by Woody Allen. Michael Caine is attracted to his wife’s youngest sister (Barbara Hershey), while his wife (Mia Farrow) is still having trouble with her ex-husband (Woody Allen). Juggling an enormous cast, Allen has produced a rich portrait of the contemporary mores of New York’s professionals and bourgeoisie. Though tackling similar themes to earlier movies, in “Hannah and Her Sisters” Allen develops a stronger emotional tone through his warm celebration of the foibles and struggles of family life. The superb cast also includes Carrie Fisher, Maureen O’Sullivan, Max Van Sydow, Dianne Wiest and Julie Kavner. The jazz score is a stand-out.

results.title: Hanimex Rondette 400S 35mm colour slide projector
results.brief_description: “Hanimex Rondette 400S 35mm colour slide projector Made in New Zealand f2.8 projector 8.5mm 230 - 240 V 50CYC A.C. Only 60W Use 12V 50W Iodine Quartz Lamp. Made in New Zealand by Hanimex Manufacturing Ltd. Green guarantee sticker on the bottom: N.Z. No 37229 Housed in original cardboard box. Air New Zealand MELBOURNE destination tag stapled to top of the box. Purchased from Christchurch International Duty Free Shop. 3 slides: - Man in Traditional dress. ‘Taken on Board Rasa Sayang. Handwritten label: BL 23 - Test slide for Reflector Adjustment - Kodachrome transparency of 3 men performing in a band. Standard 36 Han-O-Matic Magazine original box with index printed on outside. Kindermann (Adapter Rachmen) original red cardboard box. 37 Kindermann Adapters for 110 slides. Made in West Germany. Three plastic 110 Film slide viewers Paperwork included: Kodacolour II Film Instructions Hanimex La Rondette 400S QI Instructions Hanimex Magazine Instructions Hanimex Guarantee card”

results.title: Hanimex movie editor and accessories
results.brief_description:
“8mm Editor Viewer Volt 220 - 240V 18W AC 50&60Hz Lamp 6V 10W 0.2amp Made in Japan by Sansei Koko Ltd ‘For super-8, single-8 and normal 8. 100 x 75 mm colour corrected fresnel lens. Winding brake system Geared rewind Two stage sprocket wheel. Power cord attached (250V miniature cord Tatsuta, Japan N-516-777). Australian plug: Clipsal, 250V 10A 439 series Kelvin brand film reel case with film reel inside. There is a blue biro label (very faint now) which reads: MOON FILM No.35. There is a date and subject label which has been left empty..

Hanimex E400 Movie Editor Operating Instructions Foam storage base Box of Equipment 2 bulbs: Hosobuchi brand 6V 10W (Japan) 2 black plastic circles Film cement bottles: Filmkitt film cement (glass bottle - plastic lid) colle p. films Made in Germany Johnson Universal film cement (glass bottle - plastic lid) Made in England yellowed bottle and inner 25cc Size Inflammable Johnsons of Hendon Ltd Purchased from Jack Leate. Camera stores Reliable film cement for slicing both non-inflammable and inflammable cine films. M&B ‘Tricoid’ safety film cement. (glass bottle - plastic lid) Suitable for Triacetate film. Scrape surfaces, coat thinly with cement and press together for a few seconds. Avoid breathing vapour. T. 5/31/89. 28cc size 1fl. oz”

results.title: Hangman
results.creator_credit: Melrose Productions, Les Goldman and Paul Julian
results.brief_description: Follows Maurice Ogden’s allegorical poem. A hangman executes the inhabitants of a tow, one by one, without explanation. Fed by the blood of the victims no-one defended - the alien, the one who dared to object, and the Jew - the gallows tree takes root and fills the village square. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Handsome Serge = Le Beau Serge
results.brief_description: After ten years away, Francois returns to the village where he grew up and meets up with his old friend Serge. Serge used to be the envy of all because of his intelligence and beauty, but he is now only a shadow of his former self. Married to Yvonne, Serge has become an alcoholic after the couple lost their child. Francois is willing to do anything to help his friend, and the two protagonists indulge in a transfer of personal guilt, then an exchange of redemption. “Le Beau Serge” was the first film of French critic-turned-director Claude Chabrol and is widely acknowledged as the first film of the French New Wave. Two of the principal actors - Jean-Claude Brialy and Gerard Blain - also appear in Chabrol’s follow-up film, “Les Cousins”. In French with English subtitles.
